intro: Gaultheria glomerata, commonly known as the evergreen strawberry or wintergreen, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Southern Hemisphere. It is a low-growing shrub that produces small, dark red berries with a distinctive aromatic scent. The plant belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like blueberries and heathers. Its leaves are evergreen, glossy, and elliptical in shape, while its flowers are white and clustered in umbels. The berries are edible and have a sweet, tart flavor, often used in culinary applications or as a source of the compound methyl salicylate.
